item.name: Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee
Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. (text of measure as introduced: CR S14190)

summary.text: Fair Share for Military Children in Public Schools Act - Amends title VIII (Impact Aid) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to authorize appropriations for basic payments for heavily impacted local educational agencies (LEAs) for eligible federally connected children. Authorizes such funds in amounts equal to increasing portions of the full amount computed for each such LEA for each of FY2007-FY2010, until the full amount is reached for FY2011.

bill.title: Fair Share for Military Children in Public Schools Act

item.title: Fair Share for Military Children in Public Schools Act
A bill to authorize full funding of payments for eligible federally connected children under title VIII of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 by fiscal year 2011.
Fair Share for Military Children in Public Schools Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. (text of measure as introduced: CR S14190)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
